caption: Best hot toddy I've ever had... also best mushrooms,  and everything else was amazing.  This place really knows its garlic butter... not that should be a selling point, but I'd go back just for that alone.

The restaurant did not honor our original reservation because of overbooking from limited Covid seating and a miscommunication.  After writing a complaint about the experience, the GM contacted us and invited us back.  We dined at the restaurant Oct-9 and the food, wine, ambiance and service were all outstanding.  We really enjoyed the montaraz jamon iberico de bellota and ham & cheese combo board.  I look forward to dining at Bar Ramone in the future.  Thanks again
Great food, many options and quick service. Always perfect for a girls night out. It's small for sure, but you won't notice once you start eating and drinking the BEST sangria in the Bay.
We love this local restaurant and wine bar. It never disappoints. Great wine, cocktails, and food.

This place was wonderful.  The staff was quick, welcoming and gracious.  Table and people were placed socially acceptable apart during this pandemic and the staff made sure we knew the rules of the restaurant for masks.  The food was amazing, reasonably priced and came out faster than I had expected.  Not to mention, the perfect size to share between the 3 of us at our table.  The host and our waiter checked on us often and made sure we were well taken care of.  Even though we did not have any alcohol tonight, they had an amazing bar that was fully stocked and included many excellent wines.  It was an amazing space, would go back and highly recommend to anyone.
Excellent food, reasonable prices, and top notch service.
Fantastic tapas spot. Went here for restaurant week and will definitely be coming back. The food was amazing
Great service and food
My first ever at a Wine Bar and this one was an excellent choice for Happy Hour in Downton Chicago!!!
Tables were snack dab on top of each other.  Food and service was mediocre.

Unbelievable service and absolutely amazing food. Went for restaurant week and it was a fantastic deal, wine pairings included! But the food was fantastic and the service was incredible. Can't wait to go again.

Very flavorful food! A lot of your dishes will have lots of different tastes all in one bite if you pay attention which I love. Portions are small unfortunately and so don't expect to leave on an empty stomach unless you're willing to spend around $150 or more. That being said, I'm a big man so maybe it'll be less for you! Regardless, my dish recommendation would have to be the Pork Belly Skewers and the Rice with Salted caramel dessert. Holy cow were those two dishes absolutely amazing. Please do yourselves a favor and order these two things minimum!

What an amazing restaurants week experience at Bar Romane! Thanks you to our wonderful server Christina and Chef Alex for making the whole evening a true blessing. We loved every dish and enjoyed the wine pairing with the dishes. It’s like traveling to Spain without having to go too far. This restaurant has a fun atmosphere the kitchen is working in total harmony it’s beautiful thing to see. I say I can’t wait to come back to dine at Bar Romane. I recommend the burger with fries,and lamb meatballs. The glass porron wine pitcher with white wine everyone should try. Their chocolate mousse off the hook with some forfeited dessert wine it was a match made in heaven. Fabulous night and we will Love to come back again bring more friendships.
Boycottable offense

Have only sat at the bar, but really love this place. Really great happy hour with $7 glasses of wine and a free tapas bar (really simple snacks but very nice that it’s complimentary). Bartenders are always great and they pass the purrón around the bar which is fun. Tried a couple tapas which were delicious, will definitely be back to try more.

I was very disappointed. The service was very slow, the waitress took 15mn to come to our table. Besides that, the dishes are every small compared to the lot pricing. I admit that the taste is very good, but still, paying 20$ for 50g octopus is far from fair pricing. Same goes for all other dishes... Besides, the dishes did not arrive in the right order. We received a main dish, 2 appetizers, another main dish, and then later another dish, with 15mn in between.. The meat dish costs 25$ and has also around 50g !
Great service, great wine and food
Really like this bar and I think I’ll go back today

Awesome bar and restaurant. The host was very welcoming and nice! The waitress was patient with us and gave great suggestions for vegetarians as it was our first time there. We ended up getting the spicy potatoes, toasted goat cheese, and the tomatoes with olive oil, amazing food. We also had wine and sangria. Highly recommend!

Great Spanish style tapas and wine bar. The complimentary snack bar during happy hour is also a nice plus. Definitely get whatever the daily rice dish is as it is an interesting take on Paella crosses with fried rice.
After exploring downtown Chicago for a week, I can say this is the best food I’ve had there. Try their pork belly and got cheese if you visit. I can’t wait to visit this city again!
Great atmosphere and excellent service and be sure to ask for Emma T. You won't be disappointed. One of my new favorite places.
Delicious gin and tonics - real Indian Tonic here. Nice ambiance and light fixtures.
Some of the best service I have ever had. Extremely attentive waitstaff and delicious food. Happy hour from 5-7 makes it even better! Highly recommend, will return.
Delicious tapas (small plates) with kind and conscientious service. Impressive bottle list.

Delicious food, a little overpriced but it's a wine bar in River North so, you know. Happy hour has a few good options at the unlimited snack bar. Wine is really good, the xl patatas bravas are amazing. Meat and cheese platters have a decent selection but again, severely overpriced.
Excellent food and service. I would come back again.
Probably the best and sweetest people I have met during my travel ever. Take care of you. And to top it off, great food and drinks.
Impossibly nice staff and amazing food. Try the unorthodox patatas bravas
Love this place! The servers and bartenders are super nice and the food/drinks are great too! There are also free tapas during happy hour!

I visited Bar Ramone last weekend with two friends.  We ordered the pan con tomate - classic, toasted goat cheese, local mirai sweet corn, patatas bravas xl fries, garlic shrimp, lapryor farms beef burger and butifarra spanish sausage.  Everything was just fantastic and my friends even ordered a second order of the toasted goat cheese.  Our server Kristina was great and very friendly - we told her it was our first time in Chicago and she spent some time chatting with us about our trip and the things we had done.  Shortly after, the manager, Alex, came over and said he had heard it was our first visit and he brought us the blistered shishito peppers on the house as a welcome (they were awesome and it was a much appreciated surprise!).  We also ordered the green beans but they were out, so Alex offered to give us another dish and suggested the shaved brussels, which he also said would be on the house.  We were blown away by the fantastic service and the great food - it was easily our best meal out of our 5 days in Chicago.  The restaurant is also very cozy and stylish and has a great ambiance.  Thanks Bar Ramone!

The best tuna tartare I've tried in Chicago River North. The interior is very cozy and appealing. I recommend seating as close as possible to the entrance because the HVAC can't keep up with the fumes when it's busy. Everything else is great! 👌💯
Food, service and atmosphere were all great
Bar Ramone is one of my favorite bars in Chicago. Ambiance, food and wine are great. Chef Alex made an amazing custom sauce for us and the bartender made a great wine recommendation.
Nice and relaxing feel,sangria wasnt what i expected,very small portion.great place to chat,but not if your starving and looking for a meal.

This place is amazing. Super cute and the service was friendly and fun. Everything we ordered was delicious and we wished we had an extra night to go back and try more things. Definitely a place we will return to next time we are in town and will recommend to others. Great for a date night!

This place definitely gets a spot on the repeat list. Top-notch food and excellent service come together to make this a wonderful gem that won't leave your wallet groaning. While I'm not much of a cheese connoisseur, my girlfriend was very impressed by their cheese platter. Everything hit the right mark and the salmon tartar was our favorite of the night. Our server was very friendly and the wine staff had all the answers to our questions.
Go during happy hour to share small bites and some good wine!

On a Sunday afternoon/early evening the staff was friendly and attentive. Happy hour wine prices and free snacks were great. Tapas were good and fairly priced. I got to hear the English Beat and the Jam. Would return.

We sit down at our outside table. We order the happy hour red (delicious! great deal!) and the server points us to the free snack bar (!!!) full of focaccia, roasted peppers, and popcorn. As we wait for our cheese plate, the sommelier approaches us with a complimentary appetizer of olives and wishes us a good meal. Have we reached cloud nine? Wait for it. The charcuterie was to die, as was the ginger sangria to wrap up our foodventure. Waiting for our bill, the server mentions that we should download the lettuce eats app for their summer scratch off promotion. We do so and win $25 off the bill. The evening is kismet ✨ we leave full of love, wine, and happiness, eager to return.

Tapas / Wine Bar with a fun, energetic atmosphere. A large selection of wines by the glass (and bottles as well) and a very nice sized menu of small plates. Our visit was on a warm summer night and we were seated by the open front windows. Our server was very friendly and helpful, and we were welcomed by the manager as well. We shared six plates between two people. Each was reasonably priced, and very delicious. We'll be back for sure.
(Translated by Google) Tapas bar, little availability of the waiters  (Original) Bar de tapas, poca disponibilidad de los mozos
I enjoyed the cocktails more than the tapas.
Little more on the expensive side, but worth it. They have a fantastic selection of wine and the food was expertly prepared.
Food and wine very tasty.

Had an enjoyable couple of hours here. I didn't realise it was tapas-style until we sat down, but I made the best of it. Props to the owner for the decor and vibe.  I also liked how there was no dedicated host/hostess, which likely means you're not overpaying for the food and drink to supplement their wage. We were greeted immediately and sat just as quickly.
Friendly, knowledgeable staff, great selection of drinks, cool atmosphere, and they carry Glen Morangie.
Food was good, wide selection of wine, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

This place is the best!!! The service was outstanding. Even though it was very busy on a Friday night, the staff was smiling and very friendly. Amazing service from the host, the bartender and server. The cocktails are delicious. The dishes are small and shareable, and full of flavor. We loved our experience. Highly recommend!!
Great atmosphere and good drinks! It wasn’t incredibly busy for a Friday night and we got a free tapa!
Left my debit card and they had and it was super easy to get it back.

We weren’t a huge fan of one of the dishes, the scallops. We expressed our disappointment to the staff and the manager, Alec, was very understanding and considerate in hearing out our concerns and addressing them. They have work to do on the menu but the service was great.

Do not wait for a table the lead times are not accurate.  The host will give you a wait time but there’s no telling when a table will open. We were given a 90 minute window and it far exceeded that.  Can’t speak to the food but definitely will not be returning we had no problem waiting but when several parties were sat in front of us and the host admittedly told us we decided this was a total disregard for their customers. Fortunately there’s many more places to choose from just a few steps away. A place who has no regard for their customers time is not worth the wait.

I didn’t know that I was missing Spanish wines and pintxos in my life until I stopped in for dinner/happy hour last night.  Amazing happy hour offerings plus a solid regular menu with an overwhelming number of wines available.  Crispy artichoke pintxos and pan con tomate with jamon Serrano were my favourites of the night.
Fantastic pace to enjoy Spanish food. Impressive wine list and service. Cozy intimate space. Potential place for a first date or a general night out with friends
Quickly becoming one of my favorites in the city. We get 8-10 things every time we go and we have yet to be disappointed by anything we've tried.
Great service, fantastic wine selection, and delicious menu. The manager was really helpful and knowledgeable. Will definitely be back!

Some places just have ‘it’, and Bar Ramone is one of those places. Nothing crazy special or different, just a great, classy wine bar without any pretense. Can’t say enough about the people that work their! Over the course of an hour I had great interactions with no less than 5 people from waiters to bartenders, and everyone was awesome. Will definitely be back!

It isn't bad but it isn't great either. There is also some funk with the staff. They don't seem to like getting along with each other and they don't go out of their way to help guests or fellow staff members. Chicago in general doesn't have a bevy of true wine bars and this one doesn't get close to the likes of Websters, Rootstock, or Red & White. I also find it to be WAY overpriced for what you actually get. My wife and I had two glasses of wine apiece and the meat and cheese platter (which was great but small) and our bill sat around $125. We popped around to a few more places and then ended up having a full dinner at Avec and whole bottle of much better wine and our bill was $135. We won't be back to Bar Ramone anytime soon.
Ryan is the best.

I am super happy that LEYE opened a tapas restaurant in this location.  The decor is great as it the wine selection.  However, I wish the menu was a little broader, although most everything we tried was very good.  Also wished they offered carafes or pitchers of sangria and included a "classic" sangria.  Loved the Artichoke pinchos. Their "special" paella was surprisingly  tiny and would not order again.  Rice pudding and the Orange/Caramel Flan was very good. Cheesecake was a little burnt.

Crave worthy tapas and excellent wines!  Loved the Pan Con Tamate, Tuna Tartare, Marinated Goat Cheese, and the scallops.  Charred avocado was gorgeous but too sweet for our palates.  We'll definitely be back
Great staff and meal

Gabriella gave excellent recommendations on wine. I was leaning towards a chablis and she had me taste a 2003 Alto Andige chardonnay. I generally only drink chablis when it comes to chardonnay, but I was pleasantly surprised how pleasant the oak was with the higher level of acidity and maturity in the wine. The braised short rib with parsnip puree was next level and paired well with the nebbiolo I had first. I will be back and highly recommend Bar Ramone for any occasion.
Great place
Nice relaxing place to get a drink, atmosphere is interesting and a inviting.
Great service. Nice atmosphere
Visited from Melbourne. We enjoyed the selection of small plates, which was bursting with flavour in every bite.
Goat cheese and ham and cheese board were great
Good selection of wine and Spanish-style tapas. Also, if you are looking for some beautiful Trappist beer, Bar Ramone has got you covered.
Place is nice, food was average. Nice staff, ambience, just not the tapas we enjoyed

I just tried this restaurant for the first time last night and it became an instant new favorite. Our server took her time going over the menu with us. Outstanding service. We got the cheese board, brussel sprout salad, avocado, and papas bravas fries and they were all delicious. Interesting wine list. I’ll definitely be back!
Amazing atmosphere, great small plates, very good wine selection!
Good tapas and entrees. Mediocre charcuterie boards, music did not fit the vibe. Great service though!

Visited Chicago for the weekend. Of all the restaurants we visited, this was our favorite. We were there on a busy Saturday night, but service was still outstanding. Food was amazing. Will be back for sure when we visit Chicago again.
Excellent experience. Service a little slow but not a problem for us. They are just finding their bearings. We'll definitely be back. Great wine, cocktails, service & food. Beautiful space.
Unusual wines and tasty tapas in an eclectic session. Good music too.
Awesome Spanish tapas and wine.  Just a fun atmosphere.
Great wine + food!  Would recommend for a fantastic date night!

Great wines at any price and delicious small plates!  What a great addition to the Lettuce Entertainment family!  As usual they spent time making the space look cozy and sophisticated!  The wines are all delicious and the price range will make everyone happy. I didn't expect the food in a wine bar to be so good!  Many great small bite choices. The best food on the list was the rice pudding :)  Being on my way home from work will make this new spot a regular one for sure!

Bar Ramone hasn't even been open a week and I've already been twice! I love this new spot! There is something for everyone on this menu - both food and wine. The wine list is approachable for any wine drinker, with many choices you won't see anywhere else.  The ambience is warm and inviting (with great lighting!). Somehow this small wine bar worked equally well for a quiet catch up for two and a great night out for a (not so quiet) group of friends. The service is excellent - the servers were ready with great recommendations for food and wine (if you ask). Sadly after a few attempts, I have yet to master the art of the porron (the magical vessel meant for pouring wine directly into your mouth). At least this gives me another excuse to visit again!

I loved everything about this place.   The shrimp with watermelon, patatas bravas, marinated goat cheese (the menu’s descriptions were more detailed and interesting than mine).   Great atmosphere (they got the lighting just right — flattering but still able to see everything); and it’s buzzy without being crazy loud.  And the wines were spectacular, as you’d expect.   I’ll be back.
